BR_text.BRsummary: Ray cloud cluster code snippet is broken
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-link:https://docs.ray.io/en/master/cluster/cloud.html>https://docs.ray.io/en/master/cluster/cloud.html</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-code># Create or update the cluster. When the command finishes, it will print
 # out the command that can be used to SSH into the cluster head node.
 $ ray up ray/python/ray/autoscaler/aws/example-full.yaml
 
 # Get a remote screen on the head node.
 $ ray attach ray/python/ray/autoscaler/aws/example-full.yaml
 $ source activate tensorflow_p36
 $ # Try running a Ray program with 'ray.init(address="auto")'.
 
 # Tear down the cluster.
 $ ray down ray/python/ray/autoscaler/aws/example-full.yaml
 </denchmark-code>
 
 The above snippet from the docs fails at source activate tensorflow_p36 because there are no conda environments other than the default in the docker image.

comments_0.comment_text:
cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ijrsvt>@ijrsvt</denchmark-link>
  this is caused by the docker example flip
